# DIASPARA - DIAdromous Species: moving towards new PARadigms to achieve holistic scientific Advice

-   2-years: May 2024-May 2026

-   EMFAF-2023

![](images/clipboard-725413065.png)

# Background

::::: columns
::: {.column .incremental width="50%"}
-   All ICES DIADROMOUS groups (WGBAST, WGEEL, WGNAS +WGTRUTTA) have their own databases.
-   Large data calls: many types of data
    -   Biometrics, series, …
    -   Fisheries data also submitted directly to these databases
    -   Commercial & recreational
    -   Marine & continental
:::

::: {.column .incremental width="50%"}
![](images/clipboard-1207399477.png)
:::
:::::

# DIASPARA project

-   Aim: to have a **common database** for all migratory species
-   Now: ”Stock” and ”Metric” databases for all diadromous data
    -   ICES mapping: everything will use ICES language
    -   ICES tools (Datsu etc.)
-   Habitat database = ‘maps of continental habitat’
    -   Data available on Zenodo

![](images/rdbfis_lagoons.png)

::: notes
All lagoons from the GFCM database have been included. Some have actual polygons coming from national dataset. When polygons were missing, I created a small square to represent them. There is 3 different levels of details here - Polygons with no name - Polygons with name - Generated square with name
:::

# Discussion RDBFIS- DIASPARA- WGEEL (RDBES)

::::: columns
::: {.column .scrollable .incremental width="70%"}

**RDBES and use of continental habitat referential ?**

- We will prepare pg_dump of our spatial structure for eel.
- These could be integrated in the RDBES like structure (as in the RDBES)
- Integrating continental habitat in the RDBFIS
    -   Using a common ID that corresponds to the habitat data
    -   RDBFIS could use the same approach as RDBES this would allow a consistent framework at the stock level

:::

::: {.column .incremental width="30%"}
![](images/clipboard-4103952801.png)
:::
:::::

# Discussion RDBFIS- DIASPARA- WGEEL (Landings and effort)

::::: columns
::: {.column .scrollable .incremental width="70%"}


**Access to landings and effort data**

- **WGEEL** is an end user of scientific data.
- Use of RDBFIS to query aggregated landings and effort (transversal aggregated data) at the stock unit level
- Use of pre and post quality checks in TAF (use of QualiTrain RBBqc).
:::
